column4: have you tried to unmount it in a terminal? "sudo umount /media/cdrom"
tried sudo umount but it said /media/cdrom0: device is busy
here is a tutorial on how to unmount busy drives: http://ocaoimh.ie/2008/02/13/how-to-umount-when-the-device-is-busy/
im not sure i need to umount the cdrom, but instead kill the daemon that makes it busy, is it not?
yes, something is blocking the unmount, so kill it
